name: Binns v. First National Bank of California, Pennsylvania, Appellant

judges: Before Drew, C. J., Stern, Stearns, Jones, Bell, Ladner und Chidsey, JJ.
parties: Binns v. First National Bank of California, Pennsylvania, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The court below has correctly disposed of all the questions raised on this appeal. We therefore affirm the judgment on the opinion of Judge Carson refusing defendant’s motions for judgment n.o.v. and for a new trial.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Thomas L. Anderson, with him J. Oían Yarnall, for appellant.
D. M. Anderson, Jr., with him J. K. Spurgeon and Anderson,é.Anderson, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:

Argued March 21, 1951.
Before Drew, C. J., Stern, Stearns, Jones, Bell, Ladner und Chidsey, JJ.
Thomas L. Anderson, with him J. Oían Yarnall, for appellant.
D. M. Anderson, Jr., with him J. K. Spurgeon and Anderson,é.Anderson, for appellee.
May 21, 1951:
